list_definition.definition: the joint at the bend of the leg

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He fell and cut his knee
The child sat on her father’s knee
She was on her knees weeding the garden
He fell on his knees and begged for mercy.

list_definition.definition: the part of an article of clothing covering this joint

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has a hole in the knee of his trousers.

list_ex_of_english: The legs, although extended in front of the body, were slightly flexed, elevating the knees above the chamber floor and slightly separating the ankles and feet.
Synovial effusion was evident in the wrists, elbows and knees.
The shroud is usually knotted at the head and feet, and sufficiently open to expose the breast and knees of the deceased.
His hairs bristle, his knees stagger forward brokenly.
The patients were assessed at the shoulders, elbows, wrists, hips and knees and a global score was obtained by addition.
On examination the knees are painful, swollen (due to synovial thickening) and warm to the touch.
The knees are depicted with button-like protuberances.
Rheumatic polyarthritis usually involves the larger joints of the body, that is, the knees, ankles, shoulders and hips.
